justification: “Feeling of Knowing (FOK)… [is] a prospective confidence judgment about one’s ability to later retrieve knowledge about a specific subject.”
“Judgments of Learning (JOL) are prospective confidence judgments about one’s ability to later retrieve knowledge… about a learned cue or cue association.”

“…bias-free measures of confidence have been developed… (i.e. metacognitive sensitivity, or meta-d′) which measures the ability to discriminate between correct and incorrect choices with confidence judgments…”
“Moreover, metacognitive efficiency, or meta-d′/d′, measures how efficiently perceptual information is used to form a metacognitive report.”

measured_by: difference in confidence between correct and incorrect choices
justification: “Confidence judgments are deemed more accurate when correct choices are held with higher confidence than incorrect choices (discrimination)….”

measured_by: difference between mean confidence and mean performance
justification: “Calibration… is usually calculated as the difference between mean task performance and confidence. This results in overconfidence when confidence levels are higher than performance levels, and underconfidence vice versa.”
